bibl.title: Grain Funds and Market Intervention in the Roman World.
Feeding the Ancient Greek City

series.title: Groningen - Royal Holloway Studies on the Greek City after the Classical Age.

bibl.note: Paper presented during a workshop organised in Athens, in October 2004, as a panel in the Seventh International Conference on Urban History. It contains a shortened version of ideas expressed in: IDEM, The Grain Market in the Roman Empire. A Social, Political and Economic Study (Cambridge, 2005). - Grain funds in Asia Minor and elsewhere. - Grain funds an euergetism. - Coping with shortages? - Social networks. - Benefits for a privileged few? - Conclusions.
